text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1994, the PlayStation is a 32-bit console and the first produced by Sony. The PSX, the most commercialized of its time was redesigned then renamed PS One by late 2000. It has a RISC processor running at 34 MHz, 2 MB of RAM and a 24-channel ADPCM sound output. Its resolution ranges from 256 × 224 to 640 × 480 pixels, 16 million colors, and can calculate 360,000 rough polygons, 180,000 textures per second. It has a large catalog of games, with major franchises like Resident Evil, Metal Gear, Gran Turismo, and Final Fantasy.
